metadata.feature_description: Dynamically creates and manages content panes within the layout at runtime.

steps.action: Navigate to page in Edit mode and inspect ContentLayout modules
steps.expected: Each ContentLayout module should have uniquely named panes with GUID-based prefixes
steps.actual: Found two ContentLayout modules with unique prefixes: F30A_Pane1, F30A_Pane2 (2-column layout) and 9977_Pane1, 9977_Pane2, 9977_Pane3, 9977_Pane4 (4-column layout). Each prefix is a 4-character alphanumeric string generated from GUID.

steps.action: Inspect DOM to verify pane IDs
steps.expected: Pane elements should have IDs in format dnn_{prefix}_Pane{number}
steps.actual: DOM inspection confirmed: dnn_F30A_Pane1, dnn_F30A_Pane2, dnn_9977_Pane1, dnn_9977_Pane2, dnn_9977_Pane3, dnn_9977_Pane4 - all with unique prefixes matching LayoutPanePrefixGenerator pattern

steps.action: Inspect DOM to verify pane registration with skin system
steps.expected: Each pane should have data-parentpane attribute indicating registration with parent skin pane
steps.actual: All 6 ContentLayout panes have data-parentpane='TopPane' attribute, confirming they are registered with the DNN skin system and associated with the parent TopPane

steps.action: Verify panes appear in edit mode UI with pane labels
steps.expected: Pane names should be visible in the editing interface
steps.actual: Pane labels (F30A_Pane1, F30A_Pane2, 9977_Pane1-4) are displayed in the page edit mode UI, confirming successful registration with the skin pane system

steps.action: Verify multiple ContentLayout modules coexist without naming conflicts
steps.expected: Multiple ContentLayout modules on the same page should have different pane prefixes to prevent conflicts
steps.actual: Two ContentLayout modules exist on the page: one with prefix F30A_ (2 panes) and another with prefix 9977_ (4 panes). No conflicts or errors occurred because each module generates a unique GUID-based prefix via LayoutPanePrefixGenerator.GenerateNewLayoutPrefix()

steps.action: Review code to confirm conflict handling mechanism
steps.expected: Code should check for duplicate pane names and handle conflicts
steps.actual: Code review confirmed CheckPaneNamesConflicts() in View.ascx.cs throws InvalidOperationException if a pane name already exists in the skin. The unique prefix generation (4-char GUID substring) prevents conflicts in normal operation.

steps.action: Enter page edit mode and verify pane visibility
steps.expected: All ContentLayout panes should be visible in edit mode
steps.actual: All 6 panes are visible in edit mode with dashed borders indicating pane boundaries. PrepareModulePaneControl() in code sets paneControl.Visible = true to ensure parent pane visibility.

steps.expected: Modules placed in panes should be visible and editable
steps.actual: Modules are correctly displayed within their assigned panes. F30A_Pane1 shows HTML content, F30A_Pane2 shows product tiles (WEARABLES, TABLETS, TELEVISIONS), 9977_Pane2-4 show product tiles (BLU-RAY PLAYERS, MONITORS, HOME THEATERS, CAMERAS)

steps.action: Inspect DOM to verify CSS classes on pane elements
steps.expected: Each pane should have 'pane' class plus Bootstrap grid classes for responsive layout
steps.actual: DOM inspection confirmed all panes have proper CSS classes. F30A_Pane1/2: 'pane col-lg-6 col-md-6 col-sm-6 col-xs-12' (50% width). 9977_Pane1-4: 'pane col-lg-3 col-md-3 col-sm-3 col-xs-12' (25% width). Additional classes include dnnSortable, dnnModuleManager, ui-sortable for edit mode functionality.

steps.action: Locate empty pane and verify special styling
steps.expected: Empty panes should have DNNEmptyPane class and display content addition options
steps.actual: dnn_9977_Pane1 is empty and has CSS classes 'DNNEmptyPane EditBarEmptyPane dnnQuickAddModuleManager'. This matches the code in ReplaceEmptyPaneClass() which adds EditBarEmptyPane class to empty panes.

steps.action: Verify empty pane shows content addition UI
steps.expected: Empty pane should display icons/buttons to add text, images, or modules
steps.actual: Empty pane displays three icons: 'A' for adding text, image icon for adding images, and module icon for adding modules. These are standard DNN edit mode UI elements for empty panes.

observations: Pane name conflict handling is verified through code review - CheckPaneNamesConflicts() throws exception if duplicate names exist. Creating an actual conflict requires intentional misconfiguration and is not possible through normal UI operations.
Pane visibility is managed automatically by the system - PrepareModulePaneControl() ensures parent pane visibility. This is not a user-toggleable feature but an internal mechanism.
The LayoutPanePrefixGenerator uses first 4 characters after position 1 of a GUID to create unique prefixes (e.g., F30A, 9977), virtually eliminating collision risk.
Bootstrap responsive grid classes (col-lg-X, col-md-X, col-sm-X, col-xs-12) are automatically assigned based on the number of columns in the layout configuration.
